Description: Handle plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater with part of handle; underside: glazed streaky black; outer edges: stepped zigzag pattern; top: black-figure decoration consisting of bird or siren to left (head missing; some added red on chest, wing, and tail).
Dimensions: Thickness: 1 centimetres (front edge of handle plate)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 272, no. B217)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0137) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
